Find good first issues suitable for a new contributor across the specified repositories (or the current repository if none specified).

Criteria for "good first issue":

  • Labeled good first issue, first-timers-only, beginner, or similar
  • Open for at least 3 days (to confirm it is still available)
  • Not assigned to anyone (or unassigned since more than 7 days)
  • Has a clear description of what needs to be done
  • Does not require deep knowledge of internal architecture

For each issue found:

  1. Issue number and title
  2. Repository (important — there may be issues from multiple repos)
  3. Labels
  4. Days open
  5. A one-sentence explanation of what a contribution would involve
  6. A one-sentence note on why it is a good starting point

If the issue has comments from maintainers with guidance, summarize that guidance.

End with: a suggested first step for the contributor — which issue to start with and why.
